intro: Lappula diploloma, commonly known as the two-seed lappula, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces two small, capsule-like fruits that contain two seeds each, giving it its common name. It typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, along roadsides, and in sandy habitats. Lappula diploloma is a herbaceous annual plant that thrives in temperate climates.
